Key Match Events: The Cubs took advantage of some mistakes by the Dodgers, particularly in a five-run eighth inning to come back and win on Tuesday.

Bellinger hit a three-run homer to bring the Cubs within a run in the fifth, Crow-Armstrong knocked a bases-loaded single to tie the game, but a botched double-steal attempt in the ninth inning resulted in a Cubs loss.
Pre-Game Insights: Kyle Hendricks said on Monday, 'We know that we’ve got to pile up some wins. It’s one day at a time, though. You can’t win three games or four games in one day. So you come in every single day, and we know what our focus is.'
Post-Match Reflections: Cody Bellinger said, 'You’re never out of it until you're officially out of it. Obviously, we wanted to come out on top, but it was a tough one, and we've got to keep fighting.'
Counsell said that he did not call for the double steal, and said the baserunning blunders were 'inexcusable.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cubs have averaged 5.11 runs per road game, compared to four runs per game at Wrigley Field.
The Cubs have 10 of 16 remaining games coming at home.
The Cubs will play four against the Nationals (65-80) and three against the A’s (64-82) at home.
Others: The Cubs trail the Mets by five games, while the Braves are one game back of New York for the third and final NL Wild Card spot.
